title: Does Transformation Planning Match Clinical Reality?
prompt: A woman in her 40s sits alone at a worn kitchen table scattered with papers—charts, spreadsheets, official documents—bathed in soft morning light from a single window. Her hands rest on the table near a coffee mug and reading glasses; her face is turned away or obscured. Through the window behind her, a rural landscape is visible: fence line, bare fields, distant treeline under overcast sky. The room has the texture of small-town America—modest furnishings, wood grain, the quiet weight of solitary work. Capture the mood of quiet conflict between intention and outcome, the solitary burden of bridging data and policy, with the documentary stillness of photojournalism rather than narrative staging.
